oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of gunpowder plant ruins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows DuPont Gunpowder Plant ruins. The DuPont Old Hickory Gunpowder Plant produced smokeless gunpowder for the Allies during World War I. At the time of its contruction it was the largest gunpowder plant in the world. With the end of WWI, they ceased production and the US Army sold the property to a private interest. DuPont purchased their former munition operation in 1928 and began making Reemay, Rayon, and Cellophane.
